column1: 0,pcs7_compendium_part_b_en-US_en-US.txt,66,23d1934a2db4236a62c16d74d6149f26ea8d625634796d7221015829c7bbb42f,"Enter 0 if you are not using a redundant IM.
- TF-SIGNAL MODULE, ACK: Maximum acknowledgment time of the fail-safe I/O module in safety mode (F signal module group data sheet)
- TDP_DLY: Additional delay time with external DP interface (via CP 443-5 Extended)
- TCFU_DLY: Additional delay time due to the CFU - fixed system property of the CFU (100ms)
When Profinet IO is used, the following PROFINET network parameters are required.
# 7.11 Monitoring times and system response times

column3: Watchdog time of PROFINET IO devices. This can be found in the ""IO cycle"" tab in the properties of the PROFINET IO device. If no watchdog time is specified for the IO device, use three times the update time from the properties of the PROFINET IO system.
Max. PROFINET IO error detection time from the H-parameters tab of the properties of the bus system
Max. PROFINET IO switchover time from the H-parameters tab of the properties of the bus system

column1: You can find the TDP_DLY parameter on the ""Operating Mode"" tab of the CP 443-5 ext properties in HW Config.
# 7.11 Monitoring times and system response times

You can find the parameters in the properties of the PROFIBUS DP or PA master system by double-clicking the bus line. In HW Config, the following screens from which the relevant values can be taken are shown:
# 7.11 Monitoring times and system response times
TSLAVE_SO depends on the IM used.
# DP master system ET 200M with IM 153

column4: ...without F, FM, or HART module or similar

column1: # DP master system ET 200iSP with IM 152
# 7.11 Monitoring times and system response times
- Additional delay time with a DP/PA coupler in a singular system
- Or additional delay time and switchover time due to a DP/PA link in the redundant system

column2: Switchover time with unchanged PA configuration
column3: Typ.: 70 ms + number of PA field devices x 51 ms Max.: 820 ms + number of PA field devices x 50 ms

column2: Switchover time when configuration is changed during operation
column3: Typ.: 80 ms + number of PA field devices* x 67 ms Max.: 800 ms + number of PA field devices* x 130 ms

column1: * With unchanged PA field device addresses
- Additional delay time with a Y link in the redundant system

column2: Delay time with a Y link

column1: - Additional delay time by the CFU
Maximum delay time with the IM:
- A typical value is 1 ms for the ET 200M with IM 153
- The delay time must be calculated for the ET 200iSP. The following equation enables an approximate calculation of the ET 200iSP response time with the IM 152: Response time [ms] = g + 0.065 ms x b
# 7.11 Monitoring times and system response times
The following assignment applies to the base value of the IM 152:
* The specified base values are valid only for cyclic data exchange. Acyclic activities (for example, diagnostic interrupts) are not considered.

,What is the maximum acknowledgment time of the fail-safe I/O module in safety mode as mentioned in the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,The maximum acknowledgment time is referred to as TF-SIGNAL MODULE, ACK in the safety mode.","In safety mode, the fail-safe I/O module's maximum acknowledgment time is specified under TF-SIGNAL MODULE, ACK.","TF-SIGNAL MODULE, ACK denotes the fail-safe I/O module's max acknowledgment time in safety mode.","As per the document, TF-SIGNAL MODULE, ACK is the term used for the maximum acknowledgment time in safety mode.","The 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)' lists TF-SIGNAL MODULE, ACK as the maximum acknowledgment time for fail-safe I/O modules in safety mode."

- TCFU_DLY: Additional delay time due to the CFU - fixed system property of the CFU (100ms)

,How can the TDP_DLY parameter be found according to the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,The TDP_DLY parameter is located on the 'Operating Mode' tab of the CP 443-5 ext properties in HW Config.,To find TDP_DLY, check the 'Operating Mode' tab in the CP 443-5 ext properties within HW Config.","In HW Config, the 'Operating Mode' tab of CP 443-5 ext properties displays the TDP_DLY parameter.",The document directs users to the 'Operating Mode' tab in CP 443-5 ext's HW Config properties for TDP_DLY.,Locate TDP_DLY by accessing the 'Operating Mode' tab in the properties of CP 443-5 ext in HW Config.

,What is the fixed system property delay time due to the CFU as stated in the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,The CFU introduces an additional delay time of 100ms, known as TCFU_DLY.","TCFU_DLY, representing the CFU's delay time, is fixed at 100ms.","A fixed delay of 100ms is added by the CFU, referred to as TCFU_DLY.",The document specifies TCFU_DLY as a 100ms delay attributable to the CFU.,"100ms is the additional delay time (TCFU_DLY) caused by the CFU, as per the manual."

,What are the monitoring times and system response times discussed in section 7.11 of the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,Section 7.11 covers various times like TWD, TPN_FD, TPN_SO, and others related to PROFINET and PROFIBUS systems.","It details parameters such as watchdog time (TWD), error detection time (TPN_FD), and switchover time (TPN_SO).","The section explains monitoring and response times including TDP_DLY, TCFU_DLY, and TSLAVE_SO.","Key times include PROFINET IO's TWD, TPN_FD, TPN_SO, and delay times like TDP_DLY and TCFU_DLY.","7.11 enumerates critical timing parameters for system safety, like TWD for watchdog and TPN_FD for error detection."

,How is the TSLAVE_SO parameter determined for a DP master system ET 200M with IM 153 according to the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,TSLAVE_SO varies by IM model, with IM 153 configurations having switchover times from 30ms to 70ms.","For ET 200M with IM 153, TSLAVE_SO can be 70ms in any configuration or 30ms without certain modules.","The switchover time (TSLAVE_SO) for IM 153 ranges between 30ms and 70ms, depending on the setup.","IM 153's TSLAVE_SO is 70ms generally but drops to 30ms without F, FM, or HART modules.","Depending on configuration, ET 200M with IM 153 has a TSLAVE_SO of either 30ms or 70ms."

,What does the TDPPA_L_DLY parameter represent in the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,TDPPA_L_DLY accounts for additional delay times with DP/PA couplers or links in systems.,It signifies extra delay from DP/PA couplers in singular systems or DP/PA links in redundant setups.,This parameter covers delay and switchover times introduced by DP/PA couplers or links.,TDPPA_L_DLY measures added delays due to DP/PA interface components in the system.,In the manual, TDPPA_L_DLY is defined as the delay added by DP/PA couplers or links."

,What is the significance of the TY_L_DLY parameter in the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,TY_L_DLY indicates an additional 5ms delay time when using a Y link in redundant systems.,It represents a 5ms delay introduced by Y links within redundant system configurations.,The parameter TY_L_DLY specifies a 5ms delay for systems incorporating Y links.,For redundant systems with Y links, TY_L_DLY adds a 5ms delay to the response time.","A Y link in a redundant system increases delay by 5ms, as noted by TY_L_DLY."

,How is the response time calculated for ET 200iSP with IM 152 according to the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,Response time [ms] = g + 0.065 ms x b, where g is the base value and b is a variable.",Calculate it by adding the base value (g) to 0.065 ms multiplied by b.,The formula g + 0.065 ms x b approximates the ET 200iSP's response time with IM 152.,"For IM 152, response time is derived from base value g plus 0.065 ms times b.","ET 200iSP's response time with IM 152 is g + (0.065 ms x b), per the manual."

# 7.11 Monitoring times and system response times
- Additional delay time with a DP/PA coupler in a singular system
- Or additional delay time and switchover time due to a DP/PA link in the redundant system

column2: Switchover time with unchanged PA configuration
column3: Typ.: 70 ms + number of PA field devices x 51 ms Max.: 820 ms + number of PA field devices x 50 ms

column2: Switchover time when configuration is changed during operation
column3: Typ.: 80 ms + number of PA field devices* x 67 ms Max.: 800 ms + number of PA field devices* x 130 ms

column1: * With unchanged PA field device addresses
- Additional delay time with a Y link in the redundant system

column2: Delay time with a Y link

column1: - Additional delay time by the CFU
Maximum delay time with the IM:
- A typical value is 1 ms for the ET 200M with IM 153
- The delay time must be calculated for the ET 200iSP. The following equation enables an approximate calculation of the ET 200iSP response time with the IM 152: Response time [ms] = g + 0.065 ms x b
# 7.11 Monitoring times and system response times
The following assignment applies to the base value of the IM 152:
* The specified base values are valid only for cyclic data exchange. Acyclic activities (for example, diagnostic interrupts) are not considered.

,What base values are assigned to the IM 152 in different operating modes as per the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,In no redundancy mode, g is 1.5 ms; in redundancy mode, it's 2 ms.",The base value g is 1.5ms without redundancy and 2ms with redundancy for IM 152.,IM 152's g values are 1.5ms (no redundancy) and 2ms (redundancy mode).,"For cyclic data exchange, g is 1.5ms in standard mode and 2ms in redundancy for IM 152.","The manual specifies g as 1.5ms or 2ms for IM 152, depending on redundancy mode."

- TF-SIGNAL MODULE, ACK: Maximum acknowledgment time of the fail-safe I/O module in safety mode (F signal module group data sheet)
- TDP_DLY: Additional delay time with external DP interface (via CP 443-5 Extended)
- TCFU_DLY: Additional delay time due to the CFU - fixed system property of the CFU (100ms)
When Profinet IO is used, the following PROFINET network parameters are required.

column3: Watchdog time of PROFINET IO devices. This can be found in the ""IO cycle"" tab in the properties of the PROFINET IO device. If no watchdog time is specified for the IO device, use three times the update time from the properties of the PROFINET IO system.
Max. PROFINET IO error detection time from the H-parameters tab of the properties of the bus system
Max. PROFINET IO switchover time from the H-parameters tab of the properties of the bus system

column1: You can find the TDP_DLY parameter on the ""Operating Mode"" tab of the CP 443-5 ext properties in HW Config.

,What is the purpose of the watchdog time (TWD) in PROFINET IO devices according to the 'Compendium Part B - Process Safety (V9.0)'?,TWD monitors the operational status of PROFINET IO devices, ensuring timely responses.",It serves as a timer to verify that PROFINET IO devices are functioning correctly.,Watchdog time (TWD) checks device responsiveness within specified intervals.,TWD ensures PROFINET IO devices are active by monitoring their update cycles.,The manual describes TWD as a mechanism to monitor the health of PROFINET IO devices.
